title: FAQ
subtitle: Things I get asked a lot

questions.label: What are your main interests in tech?
questions.content: I'm especially interested in software development, mainly back-end development. I enjoy building systems that work behind the scenes to power applications. However, I'm also open to full-stack development, as I appreciate the value of understanding both front-end and back-end.

questions.label: Why do you prefer back-end development?
questions.content: I enjoy the logical and structured nature of back-end development. Working with APIs, databases, and system architecture feels natural to me. It’s also where I get to solve complex problems, which is something I find very satisfying.

questions.label: Have you worked on any projects?
questions.content: Yes, I’ve worked on various web-based projects, including a magazine website and a cloud storage full stack web application. These experiences have helped me apply my knowledge in real-world scenarios.

questions.label: Are you learning anything new right now?
questions.content: Yes! I'm currently exploring machine learning and how to integrate it into applications. I'm also looking into how to convert models from Python into mobile-friendly formats like Kotlin or Flutter.

questions.label: Do you work better alone or in a team?
questions.content: I can work independently, but I really enjoy being part of a team. I’ve worked in group projects where I implemented designs into code, even when the design came from team members without web experience.

questions.label: What’s something you're working to improve?
questions.content: I'm working on improving my design sense so I can collaborate more smoothly with designers. I'm also improving my English and communication skills to become a better team member in international environments.

questions.label: What's your career goal?
questions.content: I aim to become a skilled software developer, possibly specializing in back-end or full-stack development. I’m also interested in roles where I can work closely with data and machine learning.
